values:
For the past few days I've been getting together all the stuff that I collected to send to Fred.  While I was out getting packaging materials my friend Christine, who's boyfriend was just deployed to Iraq, texted me about the 2nd Annual Long Island Run for the Warriors.   So we're doing the team challenge and trying to raise money for it.  I'm really really excited that I have something besides work to put effort into. 



 
The mission of Hope for the Warriors™ is to enhance quality of life for US Service Members and their families nationwide who have been adversely affected by injuries or death in the line of duty. Hope for the Warriors™ actively seeks to ensure that the sacrifices of wounded and fallen warriors and their families are never forgotten nor their needs unmet, particularly with regard to the short and long-term care of the severely injured.

On their own, our service members and their families are awe inspiring in the face of their disabilities and hardships - courageous and resolute. However, it is with the support of a grateful nation that they remain unfaltering in their determination and find hope and purpose beyond recovery. As a united support network, all individuals, whether of great or small means, can find an opportunity to honor those who have willingly sacrificed to defend and protect our freedom. We invite you to take part in the inspirational lives of these young men and women and make it known that they never stand alone.

ONE MORE DAY.  That's all I think about.. One day longer.. One day closer.................... AKJLAKJDSJDJSLSJKLJKSDJKL ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.



yup.

I can not believe the summer is almost over!! I feel like it hasn't even began yet.  I am definitely looking forward to winter.  I wont drive a half hour to the beach on my day off in the summer, but I will certainly drive four hours at 5 am to go snowboarding for the day in the Winter.  BOO YAHH.
I can't believe Fred is oceans and deserts away from me.

Three eggwhites is NOTHING.  I am STARVING.  Jeeze eating healthy is killing me.. it's been one day.
Todays weight: 129.0   I'm going to keep track weekly.  It's not so hot out today so I'm also going to run after work today.

e-mail is going to be big while fred is still in Quwait.  For the first day he was there we were e-mailing the wrong  people hahahha.  Theres so many people with the same name as me.  One responded to Fred with "goodluck overseas, never email me again."  I'm really happy that he is where he is for right now before he goes to afghanistan.  I can't say what hes doing there or anything but it's a blessing basically.  


Hey baby whats going on? i got to Kuwait this morning around 5am Kuwait time thats prob 8pm your time i dont really know yet how the time difference works.  Its 120 outside right now its so miserable. I cant believe that i am depolyed again for a year, it seems like just yesterday i was at walking off the flight line from afghanistan at Ft. Bragg.  This base is out of control unlike anything i have ever seen, the gym looks like Golds Gym, they have a pool, a really nice phone and computer center, a PX the size of Shop Right. People around here are walking around in a fog, they dont know how good they got it here and yet they still complain. I see us getting in some trouble here but dont worry its all in good fun.  I am guessing i will be back before next August, well thats what i was told you never know though. Well i have really bad jet lagg and im going to get some sleep and then go work out. i am buying a phone card tonight so ill be able to call you it might at some crazy though. i love you so much and what you said about me being your soulmate has stuck with me i feel the same way sweetheart and im going to make you very happy once all this is over. i love you so much.
 




.

Paratroopers of the 82nd Airborne Infantry

Paratroopers come in all shapes, shades, weights, sizes, and states of sobriety, misery, and confusion. He is sly as a fox, has the nerve of a dope addict, the stories of an old sailor, the sincerity of a politician, and the subtly of Mt. Saint Helen. He is extremely irresistible, totally irrational and completely indestructible.

A Paratrooper is a Paratrooper all his life. He is a magical creature. You can kick him out of your house but not out of your heart. You can take him off your mailing list but not off your mind. Paratroopers are found everywhere... in love...in battle... in lust... in trouble...in debt...in bars and ... behind them. No one can write so seldom and yet think so much of you. No one else can get so much enjoyment out of a letter or clean clothes or a six pack.

A Paratrooper is a genius with a deck of cards. A millionaire without a cent and brave without a grain of sense. He is the PROTECTOR OF AMERICA, with the latest copy of playboy in his back pocket. When
he wants something it's usually 30 days leave, music that hurts the ears, a five dollar bill...or a woman he can count on.

Girls love them, mothers tolerate them, fathers brag about them, the government pays them, the police watch out for them and somehow they all work together. You can beat their bodies but not their minds.

You can tame their hearts but not their souls. He likes girls,
females, women, ladies, and the opposite sex. He dislikes small checks, working weekends, answering letters, eating chow, MRE's, waking up, maintaining a uniform, and the day before payday. You may as well give in. He is your long distance lover...he is your steel eyed, warm smiling, blank minded, hyperactive, over reacting, curious, passive, talented spontaneous, physically fit, good for nothing bundle of worry..... And will always be there for you regardless of how long its been since you've last talked.
The cord for my camera was plugged into the computer sitting at my feet.

I can NOT for the life of me locate my camera charger, which also happens to be the cord to upload pictures.  It's awesome that my printer lets you put memory cards into it so that you can just rip the pictures off there, EXCEPT, obviously there is some sort of error on the card.  THANK YOU.  Everything has to be SO FREAKING DIFFICULT. There isn't even anything good on the camera, it's just the principle of the matter. It's most likely on the floor in my room somewhere buried under some ugly michele kwan inspired sweater and cargo pants from the 7th grade.

I have gone through HELL to get off and book flights.  My boss is ready to let me go.  HIS DEPLOYMENT DATE HAS BEEN PUSHED BACK.  Which don't get me wrong is great, it's just I was so ready to QUIT.  It really does work out way better though.  Now I got to let my boss know in advance and Fred gets to stay stateside a little longer.   

The army is just making me lose my sanity at the moment.

Fred just left long island for the last time before he deploys. This long leave turned out to be difficult. I'm going to update from a desktop later. My heart is breaking right now. I'm going down to bragg sunday to say goodbye.

I just got back from North Carolina.  It's been really really amazing that I get to see him as much as I have been lately.  He came home last weekend and then 3 days later I was down there for the Military Ball.  I took a bunch of pictures, since he surprised me with a camera on Thursday when I got there.  I would post them except that I left it down there.. oops.

I almost forgot! I went to the boardy barn on Sunday.. If you're not from NY you most likely don't know what it is. It's a bar that is only open on Sunday and some holidays in the summer out in the hamptons. It's gigantic! there is an inside, outside, and a giant tent area. It's open from 4-8 only. It is complete INSANITY. The bouncers are extremely strict so you can't get in until you are really 21. It's a right of passage for long island adults.. into an alcohol induced coma on the LIRR on the way home. JOKE LIFE.


It was really like a huge frat party. Beer is only two dollars and its ENCOURAGED to spill it on people and everyone is covered in smiley face stickers. I began to miss my college days for a while. I honestly could barely handle it though. I rarely go out any more and the massive amount of people was a bit overwhelming. I would go back though, in a month or so... with a bodyguard.


 

these are not the most attractive pictures and there are more lurking somewhere.









my last dollar.  after this i was paying in change.





i have no idea who this is.  he didn't understand I HAVE A BOYFRIEND I DON'T WANT YOUR BEER




this is what it looks like after closing.. i'm not being dramatic. it's a mess.











.

So today a friend of mine had a little bit of a pregnancy scare.  I mean, it happens to the best of us.  The story goes like this:

She comes to my house visibly upset and we head into Smithtown to acquire a home pregnancy test. I tell her turn around and instead of going to wallgreens we should go to cvs to avoid traffic.  Since shes a little upset it's decided that i'm going to go in and purchase it for her. No problem! I'm 21, no big deal right?  Right!  Guess what.. MY BOYFRIENDS MOM WAS IN THERE. I've never even seen her outside of his house before. OBVIOUSLY TODAY I see her and RUN.  I am the worst girlfriend ever.  I am so embarrassed.  The situation has been resolved though.  It's actually really really funny looking back at it now.   My friend actually miscalculated her period.  LOVE YA GURL.
I could watch recorded episodes of house ALL DAY /NIGHT. If I hooked up the tv in my room I would never leave my bed.

I'm mass updating my journal. A few weeks ago I went to Bragg to visit Fred. We stayed off base, so technically I should say I went to Fayettville. I took about 10 pictures. None of them are us together. I forgot that I had a camera, so all except for two of them are from an hour before he dropped me off when we stopped to grab a bite to eat. The restaurant was like california pizza kitchen on psychedelics. It was actually called the funky mushroom, or something to that effect. I made the poor choice after hopelessly looking at the menu for 15 minutes to get a mishnmosh bbq chicken and bacon pizza, FAIL. Way too sweet and confusing for my taste buds. But enough about the food.



this is real.


its amazing how badly i need to wash my hair in these pictures


holy closeup GINGA



this is NOT cute



this IS cute.  


this is what i call a wonk.



i wish i could come home every day and make him smile like this...












oh and sunni had a party last weekend.  cops came. there were high schoolers in attendence, it felt wrong.     chase and i ordered $40 of chinese take out.  around 130 am sunni and i had consumed all of it.  DIET DIET DIET.  basically the usual deal.
I want summer to either be here or NOT be here. i can't take all the wet cold rain.
I can't even open my eyes.  I'm crying for NO reason.  I got my but caught on the door of my car. NO JOKE.  It's been waterworks since then.

here's some background: my boyfriend is in the army and i NEVER get to see him.. i'm not exaggerating. 


flash forward to 10:30 PM.  i have a test i have to take in the morning, so i decide not to go out.  plus hes only home for a few days, so he should have a night out with his friends.  i try not to be awkward and quiet when i hang out with him and his friends, but i know how guys are when they're with their buddies.  it's different when they got their girl around. 

now it's 4:40 am.  i wake up out of a dead sleep and my heart is POUNDING. he never called and his cell is dead.  i have this horrible gut wrenching feeling and i cant fall back asleep. honestly, i was a little upset he didn't use one of his friends phones to say good luck or even just a WHATS GOOD. okay, maybe i was more than a little upset.  i have an overactive imagination when it comes to creating situations in my head. 


skipping to 6:04 am. MGMT ripps me out of my dream to alert me to a 407 number lighting up my cell. its freddy, and he wants to know what time my test is. 9 am. can he come over? right now? yes. okay. 


he came to wish me good luck and to kiss me on the front lawn in front of a car full of his drunk friends and smelling like a bar. happiest girl in the world right here.

dinner = bbq ribs slow cooked in the crock-pot, cornbread, sauteed spinach, and corn
i figured that daniel probably doesnt want to eat soup every day until he leaves for florida.

This is really lame of me but I'm going to do it anyway. I currently weigh 129.8.  I may as well just say 130. I want to be 117 again.  I ran two miles yesterday with tobey, which was fun, until he tried to eat a couple of other dogs and bikes.

I actually need to start being a normal human being.  I do 0 physical activity these days, which doesn't coincide well with my rate of massive consumption. I tried on these shorts, my favorite shorts, from the summer.   They don't fit.  I can't get them over my ass.  I HAVE AN ASS?! WHAT?! I'm happy about that but I can stand to lose a few. I have two options at this point. The first is to get off my newly PHAT ass and work out.  The secondddddd is to purchase a new wardrobe. I guess the second isn't actually possible..

livejournal wont let me include the pictures behind a cut and it's really aggravating me. so here they are destroying your friends page.. OK i'll try one more time.. upon arrival to the hotel daniel discovered complimentary bathrobes and the most comfortable hotel beds we have ever encountered on the plane daniel thought i was reading a book titled "sea of poopies" majority of the pictures of myself were taken by myself yes, even mirror shots are included this is the view of the mountain from the bus stop in front of the hotel. it barely shows a quarter of the mountain. babybro's first encounter with POWDER. apparently daniel got out of the shower after our first day riding to find me passed out with my head under the bed so beat. happy valentines day. it's almost 5 am, oops. i may need to post the rest at a later date. i'm going to forget.

i'm on twitter now, as if i need to be a member of yet another online SOMETHING.  i don't even know what it is.  it seems as if twitter is based upon the idea of facebook status updates. this makes me think that the concept of what facebook status has become recently is actually derived from twitter itself, since twitter has actually been around for quite some time? 

i say what facebook status has become recently because i noticed that it no longer includes "is" after your name.  the whole status update began with first and last name followed by is and then the update "caitlin steele is washing socks." now it would simply be "caitlin washing socks." let's be real though, i rarely wash my socks so that would NEVER be my status update. i don't wear dirty socks or anything, i just let an entire laundry basket(or corner of my room) fill up before i make that long journey downstairs to the cold laundry room.  realistically it would be something like "caitlin I slang in my white tee I bang in my white tee All in the club spittin game in my white tee." 

my mom needs a twitter, she updates her fb status entirely too much. i actually found another website similar to fml and those other ones that i posted recently. this one is based upon the horror of having parents, or just family members in general, on facebook monitoring your every extremely inappropriate behavior on the internet. 
http://myparentsjoinedfacebook.com/
it's not really updated very, but i read through some if it.  i can definitely relate.  

i'm not sure where my rambling about the internet is going right now. i should stop myself now before i begin a tangent about my fascination with LOLCATS  and obsessive stalking of dlisted.com, so i will.

dayna, you have given me the urge to go to target so bad and spend money on ridiculous things like rain boots and mens undershirts. i am resisting, only because I'M BROKE. it's still painful. i wish i had a charge card.

add this to the list of things i wish i knew a year ago
honestly most of these places i wouldn't enjoy anyway, but still!
apparently my laptop was days ahead in the future
daft punk harder better faster stronger has been in my head for a month.

i'm updating from my kitchen table.  about a week ago i had asked my mom if i could have the "rainy day change" from the bin. she gave me a very nasty "NO FUCKING WAY." owen is currently dumping said change into plastic bags and instructing me to vacate the premises and get to the bank. i am scared.


UPDATE*$155 in change, word.
sabrina the teenage witch.. really? why is this still on tv.

i got a SICK new snowboard bag for utah.  daniel needed one because he's never traveled with his board before.  i had one from the few times i went to colorado but it had some rips in.  i took it upon myself to enhance those with a steak knife. plus daniel put the bag on his gift card. WIN. we leave in 8 days. i can't wait. 

actually i dont think that i'm even excited about the bag at all. i'm just excited to get the hell off long island. 


oh and.. i've been valentined. that is UNHEARD of.

Go placidly amid the noise and the haste,
and remember what peace there may be in silence.

As far as possible, without surrender,
be on good terms with all persons.
Speak your truth quietly and clearly;
and listen to others,
even to the dull and the ignorant;
they too have their story.

Avoid loud and aggressive persons;
they are vexatious to the spirit.

If you compare yourself with others,
you may become vain or bitter,
for always there will be greater and lesser persons than yourself.
Enjoy your achievements as well as your plans.
Keep interested in your own career, however humble;
it is a real possession in the changing fortunes of time.

Exercise caution in your business affairs,
for the world is full of trickery.
But let this not blind you to what virtue there is;
many persons strive for high ideals,
and everywhere life is full of heroism.
Be yourself. Especially do not feign affection.
Neither be cynical about love,
for in the face of all aridity and disenchantment,
it is as perennial as the grass.

Take kindly the counsel of the years,
gracefully surrendering the things of youth.
Nurture strength of spirit to shield you in sudden misfortune.
But do not distress yourself with dark imaginings.
Many fears are born of fatigue and loneliness.

Beyond a wholesome discipline,
be gentle with yourself.
You are a child of the universe
no less than the trees and the stars;
you have a right to be here.
And whether or not it is clear to you,
no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should.

Therefore be at peace with God,
whatever you conceive Him to be.
And whatever your labors and aspirations,
in the noisy confusion of life,
keep peace in your soul.

With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams,
it is still a beautiful world.
Be cheerful. Strive to be happy.
